bandcamp.name: Bandcamp
bandcamp.description: A platform for independent musicians and labels to share and sell music directly to fans.

behance.name: Behance
behance.description: A platform owned by Adobe for showcasing and discovering creative work.

bluesky.name: Bluesky
bluesky.description: A decentralized social network project initiated by Jack Dorsey.

deviantart.name: DeviantArt
deviantart.description: An online community showcasing various forms of user-made artwork.

dribbble.name: Dribbble
dribbble.description: A platform for designers to showcase their work and connect with creative professionals.

facebook.name: Facebook
facebook.description: A social networking platform connecting people and communities.

flickr.name: Flickr
flickr.description: An image and video hosting service known for its photographer communities.

gitea.name: Gitea
gitea.description: A community-managed lightweight code hosting solution written in Go.

github.name: GitHub
github.description: The largest platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories.

gitlab.name: GitLab
gitlab.description: An open-core DevOps platform for managing Git repositories and CI/CD pipelines.

instagram.name: Instagram
instagram.description: A photo and video sharing app owned by Meta.

kakaotalk.name: KakaoTalk
kakaotalk.description: A South Korean mobile messaging app with social and commerce features.

linkedin.name: LinkedIn
linkedin.description: A professional networking platform for job seekers and businesses.

linkedin_company.name: LinkedIn Company
linkedin_company.description: Company and brand pages on LinkedIn for networking and hiring.

mastodon.name: Mastodon
mastodon.description: A decentralized open-source social network based on federated servers.

medium.name: Medium
medium.description: A platform for reading and writing long-form content and blogs.

onlyfans.name: OnlyFans
onlyfans.description: A subscription-based platform popular with creators offering exclusive content.

patreon.name: Patreon
patreon.description: A membership platform that helps creators get paid directly by fans.

pinterest.name: Pinterest
pinterest.description: A visual discovery engine for finding ideas like recipes and style inspiration.

quora.name: Quora
quora.description: A question-and-answer platform where users can share knowledge.

reddit.name: Reddit
reddit.description: A network of communities based on people's interests.

snapchat.name: Snapchat
snapchat.description: A multimedia messaging app known for disappearing content and AR filters.

soundcloud.name: SoundCloud
soundcloud.description: An online audio distribution platform and music sharing website.

spotify.name: Spotify
spotify.description: A digital music service that gives access to millions of songs and podcasts.

stack_overflow.name: Stack Overflow
stack_overflow.description: A Q&A website for professional and enthusiast programmers.

steam.name: Steam
steam.description: A digital distribution platform for video games and software.

substack.name: Substack
substack.description: A platform that lets writers publish paid email newsletters.

telegram.name: Telegram
telegram.description: A cloud-based instant messaging app emphasizing speed and privacy.

threads.name: Threads
threads.description: A text-based conversation app developed by Meta as a Twitter alternative.

tiktok.name: TikTok
tiktok.description: A short-form video platform for creating and sharing content.

tumblr.name: Tumblr
tumblr.description: A microblogging and social networking website.

vimeo.name: Vimeo
vimeo.description: A video-sharing platform catering to professionals and artists.

wechat.name: WeChat
wechat.description: A Chinese multi-purpose messaging, social media, and mobile payment app.

x.name: X (formerly Twitter)
x.description: The rebranded version of Twitter, now focused on AI and long-form content.

xing.name: Xing
xing.description: A career-oriented social networking site mainly used in German-speaking countries.

youtube.name: YouTube
youtube.description: The most popular video-sharing platform for user-generated content.
